channel.title: MangOH red 8548
channel.description:
Hi all,
I just got my PCB and trying to connect to PC. Driver installed - ok SSH 192.168.2.2 - ping not working (using USB connection) Firmware update - doesn't work ``` Enabling selective suspend ... Firmware download failed. Primary error code: 77 - Failed in streaming download stage. Secondary error code: 68 - Received incorrect response. Device error code: 0x81 - Invalid product type.
Preexisting images information: Current: Firmware: ImageId: 001.040_000 BuildId: 00.03.03.01_VERIZON Configuration: ImageId: 001.040_000 BuildId: 00.03.03.01_VERIZON Final images information: Current: Firmware: ImageId: BuildId: Configuration: ImageId: BuildId:
OEM PRI:
IMEI:
Total time elapsed: 26688 ms.
Time to switch to boot mode: 2672 ms.
Images downloaded: Image ID: 001.027_000 Build ID: 02.32.02.00_SIERRA failed
Time to reset to application mode: -1 ms. ``` The link to the documentation doesn't work as well: ![Screenshot_1|690x360](upload://soGUR1v7MqBTRWVUQZi8Zhez0BE.png)

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
1. you need to check if there is a new usb0 network interface newly generated
  2. you need to first install the usb driver and see if /dev/ttyUSB serial port are generated. After that you can use minicom to communicate with modem via AT command port /dev/ttyUSB2.

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
Sorry, I am not familiar with Ubuntu.

  1. I have connected over USB my MangOH red
  2. lsusb shows me a modem

I still have no idea on:

  1. How I can access mangoh over SSH
  2. How I can send AT-command to the modem

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
For AT command port in linux, you can install this USB driver:

https://source.sierrawireless.com/resources/legato/drivers-for-wp75xx_wp76xx_wp8548-series-modules---latest-release/#sthash.Q2A8BRYl.dpbs

For the USB ECM driver, it is generic one which is already ubuntu

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
I don’t have a case at all.

Anyway, I have connected the device to Ubuntu… now I am stuck with drivers and settings. Are any docs available?

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
maybe the metal case of your mangoh red board is not in good position which lost the connection of UART2

You can use your finger to add some pressure to the metal case and see if there is output in UART2

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
Hi,

  1. Have those results:
AT!MAPUART?
!MAPUART: 1,16

OK
  1. If you want the console log to be printed in UART2 (CONSOLE USB connector), you need to enter
  • Still nothing

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
you might also check AT!MAPUART?
If you want the console log to be printed in UART2 (CONSOLE USB connector), you need to enter

AT!entercnd="A710"
at!mapuart=16,2
AT!reset

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
But it doesn’t help. No logs.

I will try on Ubuntu tomorrow
Thank you for your time and effort

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
just connect the USB cable to the Windows and CONSOLE USB connector, you should see one more port generated in device manager.
After that you can use tera term or Putty with baud rate 115200 to see if there is anything ouput.

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
No idea why you cannot see the ECM interface in network adaptor page…
Are you installing this USB driver?

https://source.sierrawireless.com/resources/legato/drivers-for-wp75xx_wp76xx_wp8548-series-modules---latest-release/#sthash.Q2A8BRYl.dpbs

Have you tried on Linux?

BTW, what did you see in the UART console?

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
jyijyi:

AT!USBCOMP=?

AT!ENTERCND="A710"
OK
at!USBCOMP?
Config Index: 1
Config Type:  1 (Generic)
Interface bitmask: 0008010D (diag,nmea,modem,rmnet0,ecm)

OK
AT!USBCOMP=?
!USBCOMP:
AT!USBCOMP=<Config Index>,<Config Type>,<Interface bitmask>
  <Config Index>      - configuration index to which the composition applies, sh                                                          ould be 1

  <Config Type>       - 1:Generic

  <Interface bitmask> - DIAG     - 0x00000001,
                        NMEA     - 0x00000004,
                        MODEM    - 0x00000008,
                        RAWDAT   - 0x00000040,
                        RMNET0   - 0x00000100,
                        RMNET1   - 0x00000400,
                        RMNET2   - 0x00000800,
                        AUDIO    - 0x00010000,
                        ECM      - 0x00080000,
                        NCM      - 0x00400000,
  e.g.
  9  - diag,modem interfaces enabled
  10D - diag,nmea,modem,rmnet0 interfaces enabled

OK

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
How to check it?
More info maybe will help:

  1. I am using win11
  2. Drivers have installed already and I see 2 new ports and a modem
  3. Device connected to the PC via USB and CF3 USB

For SSH I am using putty, but 192.168.2.2 is not available. I don’t have any other tools.

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
It should not be cellular interface if you are using USB ECM interface for SSH.
Have you checked the following and see if ECM interface has been enabled?

AT!ENTERCND="A710"
at!USBCOMP?
AT!USBCOMP=?

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: pylyps
item.description:
I did it now, but i have new adapter baned Cellular 2

Read full topic

item.title: MangOH red 8548
item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
you need to do the following for the USB ECM interface:

Sierra Wireless Forum – 10 Jan 22

WP7608 not recognized by DevStudio

For windows, go to control panel → Network and sharing Center → change adapter setting → find the ethernet icon with “Ethernet” which is the Sierra wireless ECM interface-> right click → property → click the properties of "Internet Protocol...

For the UART console:

Read full topic

I just got my PCB and trying to connect to PC.

SSH 192.168.2.2 - ping not working (using USB connection)
